reasoning: The ‘critique’ merely asserts that WAM-convergence is unlikely under good conditions, which is a core claim of the original position rather than an objection to it. So it does not attack any part of the position (centrality ~0) and therefore does not refute or weaken it (strength 0). The statement is clear and focused, with no extraneous content. Its factual correctness independent of the position is uncertain but plausible, so correctness is moderate-high; however this does not translate into argumentative strength against the position.
title: Widespread accurate moral convergence remains unlikely even under ideal conditions
